page.title: 11INDUSTRY
page.content: Traditionally industry was connected with farming; flour mills, wool storage, sheep/cattle markets. This picture is changing. New industry is being encouraged. A paper factory in Sth.Willesborough supplies the Office trade. In Sth.Ashford there are two group periods; post war, which is a series of flat roofed concrete structures, revamped and 'glassed' as they have grown. Among these are instant print, milk bottling, carpet storage and tool making. The second now consists of 150 or so modern blocks pushing on to the flood plain area of the East Stour. As yet, not all the units are operating. Bearings, tyre storage, office furniture, pneumatic pipe work, double-glazing, brewing and car mnt. are covered.
